column2: PY-11317 Incorrect type detection for formatter string with java String ...

column3:
Improve skeleton generator to using predefined return type in the doc generator
via user  PREDEFINED_MOD_CLASS_SIGS map.

The main issue which is exists here related to that the str or unicode
in mod method don't have any return type in the doc string.

After applying 1 option I think that everything should work. But not =(
It seems that doc string have more priority then returned type (?) =(

Thus I also perform operation of adding additional description to the doc
which describe return type in format which idea is parsing.
Please note that such behavior performs only for
PREDEFINED_MOD_CLASS_SIGS map
After regenerating the skeleton we have such picture:
And Idea detects correct type for formating string behavior.
A better place for this fix is python-skeletons.

Do you mean python/skeletons folder? To fix this you proposed update
such skeletons:

If not, could you please describe a little bit more where the better
place to fix this?
No. Please take a look at JetBrains/python-skeletons repo. The idea behind Python skeletons + how to use/modify them is described in README.md.

Ahhh... Thanks a lot... So this possible fix is not convenient for plugin/pycharm?
Should I close it?

Issue after using python-skeletons is reproduce... Reopen
It seems stubs which is generated have more priority then
python-skeletons....
Any suggestions how to fix this?
Resolve issue with python-skeletons after perform such steps:
Close again... Sorry for this monologue =)
